column4: Hi all. I'm running 11.10. When I put a video on my mp4 player, it doesn't work. If I use Windows 7 to put the file on the mp4 player, it works. I've done the medibuntu thing and have had no luck.
the same video?
Yes, same vid
In PCLOS I can make it work after installing task-multimedia but I've never had luck with ubuntu
The thing is, I want to use ubuntu and only ubuntu
when the player is connected is it shown as a mass storage or somthing else
yes
and you can play the video in ubuntu
yes
I've tied using other machines but it makes no difference. Something must get lost in the codecs or something. I'm too noobish to figure this one out. :)
it's wierd it is just a file transfer so it should work
yes, that's what I think
Believe it or not, I've had this problem for over a year. Been here about 10 times hoping to find an answer
I wish I could just install task-multimedia
but that's for PCLOS
what dose it do?
either it will say "Unsupported format" or if it does play it's broken and you cannot even tell what the pic is.
It also sounds like a needle being dragged across a record.
I've tried using WinFF to reformat and try different types of formats. No luck
only thing i could find

sudo apt-get install libxine1-ffmpeg gxine mencoder mpeg2dec vorbis-tools id3v2 mpg321 mpg123 libflac++6 ffmpeg totem-mozilla icedax tagtool easytag id3tool lame nautilus-script-audio-convert libmad0 libjpeg-progs flac faac faad sox ffmpeg2theora libmpeg2-4 uudeview flac libmpeg3-1 mpeg3-utils mpegdemux liba52-0.7.4-dev libquicktime2
g2g good luck by
